Jakša Tomović

Developer · Product Studio · Custom motorcycles

I build opinionated tools and loud machines.

I’m a developer based in Croatia, focused on calm software that solves real problems and leaves room for craft. Right now I’m scaling AirShare—a peer-to-peer delivery tool for shipping builds and libraries in seconds without touching the cloud. I’m also prototyping Keero, a decentralized secure chat for product teams powered by OpenMLS and Iroh. Off-screen, I wrench on custom bikes as Canarin Garage.

Custom Garage

Canarin Garage

One-off motorcycles built with the same care I put into software—obsessed with details, handcrafted, and always a little loud. Let’s design something that doesn’t exist yet.

Shipping now

AirShare

Instant, encrypted file delivery that rides over QUIC with local discovery and global relays when you need them.

AirShare keeps builds private and blazing fast—peer-to-peer transfers on your LAN, plus invite-only global routes powered by Iroh, automatic device discovery, and zero reliance on cloud storage.

Next.js TypeScript Tailwind CSS
Visit website

Mako Writer

Draft. Shape. Publish.

AI-powered writing workspace for fiction and non-fiction books. Build outlines, generate chapters, and polish manuscripts with structured workflows.

Desktop Writing App

Built as a Tauri desktop app with AI-assisted drafting, project structure, publishing tools, and long-form writing support.

Hardware

Keero Device

Embedded voice-assistant build in active development on ESP32-S3, with custom audio pipeline, UI, and device tooling.

Follow the current Keero hardware work, firmware progress, and system-level engineering updates on the dedicated Hardware page.

I believe in simplicity, functionality, and beauty—whether in code, design, or motorcycles.

Every project is a chance to blend engineering discipline with a garage builder’s curiosity. If you’re working on something ambitious, or you just want to talk shop, I’d love to hear from you.
